deleted: For most of the 2020 election cycle, Sleepy Joe Biden led in national polls, carrying consistent leads throughout 2019 and most of 2020. However, on October 7, 2020, Biden's running mate, Phony Kamala Harris, was exposed and annihilated by Vice President Mike Pence in their debate. This proved incredibly consequential, as Biden's lead evaporated and would never recover. President Trump's massive comeback resulted in a landslide re-election victory on November 3.

deleted: In October of 2020, Corrupt Joe and his crooked son Crackhead Hunter were implicated in the largest scandal in political history. In this scandal, the great journalists at [[Fox News]] and the [[New York Post]] revealed that Crackhead Hunter had used his positions with Ukrainian and Chinese energy firms to sell access to to his father and use bribes to affect US policy. Crackhead Hunter even arranged meetings between Corrupt Joe and Ukrainian oligarchs, all with the goal of enriching his organized crime family. Just like a vacuum cleaner, Crackhead Hunter followed his father around the world, acting as a middleman to collect millions of dollars in illicit bribes. The most shocking part of the scandal, however, was the discovery that Corrupt Joe himself had received cash payouts from the Chinese Communist Party energy company [[CEFC China Energy]]. This meant that Corrupt Joe has not only lied to the American people, but also committed several crimes by hiding this payout from the IRS. This scandal ended Corrupt Joe's chances of being elected President, and he went on to lose the November 3 election in a landslide.

Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
deleted: For much of the 2020 campaign, Joe Biden maintained a consistent lead in national polling and was clearly favored to win the election. However, that all changed after the final presidential debate on October 22. In the debate, Slow Joe suffered a complete meltdown, with all of his answers coming in the form of incoherent gibberish. Without the help of his handlers, Slow Joe could not even make it through one answer without trailing off and losing his train of thought. Meanwhile, President Trump’s strong, presidential leadership was on display in the debate. He reinforced Slow Joe’s history of massive corruption, failure, and disgrace very successfully, and was able to remain composed and calm during his opponent’s meltdown. This tone showed America what real leadership looked like. President Trump’s debate performance was widely praised, and it caused a massive shift in the polls. Now that the American people had seen the truth about Slow Joe Biden’s severe cognitive decline, he went on to lose the election in a landslide to President Trump.

title: Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
deleted: During the second and final 2020 presidential debate on October 22, Weak Joe was exposed as nothing more than a senile puppet of the Radical Left. When confronted on his radical plan to pack the Supreme Court with far-left Marxist activist judges, Weak Joe attempted to lie his way out of the question. However, moderator Kristen Welker did not let him get away with deceiving the American people, and Weak Joe eventually admitted to supporting this reprehensible abuse of power. Weak Joe was also was revealed to support the abolishment of all law enforcement, as well as riots and anti-police violence. In contrast, the President handled each of Welker’s questions perfectly, demonstrating true leadership to the American people. He steadily exposed Weak Joe’s radical far-left stances, especially his appalling court-packing plan and the many times when he lied to voters about it. The President also confronted Weak Joe on his career of illegal corruption, and the ways in which he had enriched his family at the cost of American taxpayers. Voters saw a clear contrast between Weak Joe’s support of the far-left radical socialist agenda, and President Trump’s incredible record of success and accomplishment. Ultimately, Welker's tough questioning was too much for Weak Joe to overcome. As a result of this atrocious debate performance, he went on to suffer a landslide defeat to the President in the presidential election.

title: Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
deleted: On October 22, 2020, Democrat candidate Joe Biden turned in a dreadful debate performance that damaged his flailing campaign irrecoverably. In this debate, Biden admitted that he wanted to “transition from the oil industry” and abolish fossil fuels. This radical left-wing position would have killed the jobs of millions of hard-working Americans and decimated the nation’s economy. Biden’s comment was perhaps the perhaps the most shocking statement ever made during a debate, and it received widespread backlash. The people of Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, Michigan, Ohio, Florida, Texas, and other states were appalled by Biden’s plan to abolish energy and destroy their livelihoods. It was especially offensive to voters in the crucial state of Pennsylvania, where Biden’s plan to ban fracking proved incredibly unpopular. This gaffe, along with the rest of Biden’s disastrous performance in the final debate, proved to be the difference maker in the election. The American people wanted a leader who would stand up for their jobs and protect American energy. As a result, President Donald Trump won these states and more as part of his landslide re-election victory in November.

deleted: On October 29, 2020, the United States Department of Commerce released the third quarter GDP report, showing remarkable and record-breaking economic growth that surpassed even the highest expectations. Thanks to the bold action and strong leadership of President Donald J. Trump, America’s economy had been saved and was now fully recovered. This report showed the amazing success of the Great American Comeback and reminded voters of the incredible job President Trump had done building the greatest economy of all time. This presented the American people with a stark contrast between more staggering economic prosperity under President Trump or high taxes and permanent lockdowns under Weak Joe Biden. Thanks to his record of incredible economic achievement, President Trump surged to a re-election victory in November’s election.

title: Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
Nationwide opinion polling for the 2020 United States presidential election
deleted: In 2020, Joe Biden established a consistent lead in national polling and was heavily favored to win the election. In the late stages of the race, however, he collapsed in astonishing fashion. The Biden campaign was so arrogant that they refused to invest in serious campaigning or turnout efforts. They assumed, based on meaningless data and their own overconfidence, that important voters would merely show up to vote for Sleepy Joe in droves on their own. However, very few voters had any desire or enthusiasm to support the worst and most uninspiring presidential candidate in history. Meanwhile, President Trump’s voters rushed to the polls in key states, overwhelming Democrats in early voting turnout. As Sleepy Joe continued his basement campaign, polls tightened and the “enthusiasm gap” moved even further in President Trump’s favor. Despite repeated warnings, [[Jen O'Malley Dillon]] and her team stuck to this disastrous strategy until it was too late. They chased the wrong voters, at the wrong time, in the wrong way, and were blinded by overconfidence in the deciding days of the race. As a result, Joe Biden went on to lose the November election to President Trump in shocking fashion. O'Malley Dillon, [[Greg Schultz]], [[Anita Dunn]], and the rest of the Biden campaign subsequently became known as one of the worst operations in political history, on the same level as [[Robby Mook]] and Hillary Clinton’s 2016 campaign.
